title: Is any plan on designing a scopes chaining Context API like the old context did?
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

Feature

**What is the current behavior?**

Although the React 16 new Context API solved many pain points of the old unsafe Context API, I still wish we have an appropriate communication mechanism to access scope context. The descendant component always reads a context value from its closest ancestor's context value.

**What is the expected behavior?**

Have another new Context API support context scopes chaining/cascading, components read context from bottom to up, and contexts could be shadowed by any components. This API also prevent the old Context API (React 16- ) issues (e.g. update blocking).

A reasonable situation is like:

```jsx
<Layout theme="primary">              // primary
    <Header>                          // primary
        <Button />                    // primary
    </Header>
    <Main>                            // primary
        <Button theme="warning" />    // warning
    </Main>
    <Footer theme="danger" >          // danger
        <Button />                    // danger
    </Footer>
</Layout>
```

With such a Context Api,  we can have a components libarary that once setted a scoped 'theme' context, the 'theme' effects all its children. We also can use it control the scope 'size', scope 'privilege', scope 'locale', and any other scope behaviours.
